messages.message: does anyone know why `rabbitmq` is currently down in dogfood? it seems that this issue has been occurring on-and-off today (see thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C02KS5FHZEE/p1650449323753729))

This might be related to this - https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C01E4D91VK5/p1650446598759929?thread_ts=1650432409.546249&channel=C01E4D91VK5&message_ts=1650446598.759929 (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C01E4D91VK5/p1650446598759929?thread_ts=1650432409.546249&channel=C01E4D91VK5&message_ts=1650446598.759929)
@puneet can you perform the steps that Sudeep is recommending?
I did that earlier and it fixed the issue.
OK, so is this a new issue that @Serena is reporting?  Or, has this been fixed?
Will try to do that again in some time and confirm if it is the same thing
The problem earlier today was because of a race condition. The fix we did was not a permanent fix which is something @kunal and @shiqi are looking into.
I can see that rabbitmq is up, we need to rerun the dogfood job to repush everything out. I’m going to trigger manually.

I think @jtau pushed rabbitmq to fix the issue.
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CCY413CSU/p1650474164375299?thread_ts=1650472237.359399&channel=CCY413CSU&message_ts=1650474164.375299 (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CCY413CSU/p1650474164375299?thread_ts=1650472237.359399&channel=CCY413CSU&message_ts=1650474164.375299)
@Serena that’s a different cluster, that’s the dogfood-alt cluster. In dogfood, it should be a statefulset-rabbitmq.

> OK, so is this a new issue that @Serena is reporting?  Or, has this been fixed?
@shaunak just saw this thread - it looks like the same issue from earlier in the day that re-occurred again with the race condition in the deployment pipelines leading to incorrect SHA being pulled post deployment (causing image pull errors).

there was an alert for this around little earlier for this. As Puneet mentioned this was fixed by Jtau manually.
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C01E4D91VK5/p1650472621105199
